Message:
During one of my routes,
it started to rain.

I hurriedly covered my mailbag
with my jacket,
but one letter got wet...

The elderly woman receiving it
gazed sadly at the smudged ink.

It was her monthly letter
from her grandchild
who lived far away.

“Oh, it’s no problem at all.
Accidents happen, don’t they?”

She smiled gently,
but a glint of loneliness
lingered in her eyes.

Even so, I didn’t know
what kind of expression
I should make in response.

As I was writing
my work report that night,
my pen froze in realization.

“I let an important letter
from her grandchild get wet.”

How could I have done that?
I should’ve understood
the importance of family
better than anyone else...
